newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss money market rates ease into November.
newsitem.headline: Swiss money market rates ease into November.

text.p: Swiss tomorrow/next money rates eased from earlier this week, with one bank quoting the rate this morning at about 1-1/2 to 1-5/8 percent.

That compared with levels in some cases as high as 2.00 percent earlier this week as demand increased before month's end. Traders said the SNB did currency swaps in the money market this morning. Banks said the swaps were priced at 75 pips. The swaps were set to remain in the market until January 3, one bank said.

"No unusual operations," said one Swiss National Bank (SNB) spokesman in response to a query about the SNB's money market operations. Money market dealers also said the SNB's operations were routine. -- Zurich Editorial, +41 1 631 7340
